actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 7, 2026.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Clyburn moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The House received a communication from the Honorable John H. Rutherford. Mr. Rutherford submitted his resignation from the Committee on Ethics. The resignation was accepted without objection.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER MOTION TO DISCHARGE
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Jeffries notified the House of his intent to offer a motion to discharge the Committee on Rules from further consideration of H. Res. 780 pursuant to clause 2(c) of rule XV. The Chair announced that the House will entertain the gentleman's motion within two legislative days.

Mr. Thompson (PA) asked unanimous consent that the order of the House of January 3, 2025, providing for Morning-Hour Debate be extended for the remainder of the 119th Congress, except that H. Res. 976 shall supplant H. Res. 6. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 976 — "Providing for the hour of meeting of the House."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 975 — "To inform the Senate that a quorum of the House has assembled."
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 974, the Chair announced the appointment of Representatives Scalise and Jeffries to the Committee to Notify the President.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 974 — "Providing for a committee to notify the President of the assembly of the House of Representatives."
The Chair designated Mr. Rose to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Call of the House Quorum responded: 406 present (Roll no. 1).

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the resignation of the gentlewoman from Georgia, Ms. Greene, and the passing of the gentleman from California, Mr. LaMalfa, the whole number of the House is 431.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
